title: what item for mr?
body:
If ur against ad you can start cloth armor
If you're against poke you can get boots
If you're ad you can get doran blade
If you're ap you can get doran ring
For sustain I can get pots or corruption and stuff

What do I get for start item MR!?!?

replies.body:
Princess Yaia has pretty much hit this one on the head. Sustain definitely wins out over flat MR early, as the majority of magic damage in the early game will deplete mana on a majority of mages, so health sustain is a great way to win that war. Magic Resistance really does come into runes for a lot of champions too. 

- Flat MR is against an opponent who has high poke/kill pressure early.
- Scaling MR will allow you free stats after Level 8 but will pose you to be weaker before this point. This is great when the enemy is a weaker laner or someone who will not be pressuring you hard in the early game.

Making sure you get the mastery point to turn hp pots into cookies is a great way to get bonus sustain in lane. Having a couple of them will grant you better sustain then pots alone!

You can start {{item:1033}} {{item:2003}}  if you really want to. I find that {{item:2033}} is a better start though.

I see what you mean how its not "balanced" since you start {{item:1029}}  4x {{item:2003}}  but you only get 1 potion against AP champions. But that is usually because AP champions are spell-based whereas AD champions Autos hurt as much as their abilities.

There is always {{item:1054}} too

You don't start a match with MR. Usually the starting stats of AP are negligible compared to other stats (such as AD). 
Best bet is to start with a sustain start as the majority of champions you will need to build MR against are poke based. Those who lean more towards burst (kat, fizz, alkali), will generally allow for a bit of farming before they hit their powerspikes (so make sure you back before then and buy some MR!)

If you insist of stating with a bit of MR, I suppose you could start with null magic mantle and a pot.
